column4: hey anyone need help tryin to connect using ssh locally to my windows machine
and cant
please advice
winscp
i just use my local ip to test it
sorry, meant to say what ssh server you have on your windows machine?
you said you are trying to connect "to" your windows? or do you mean from your windows to your linux machine?
you get an error?
can you ping your linux box from windows?
another question are you trying to scp to transfer files, or ssh to use linux command prompt?
winscp is for scp to transfer files, try downloading putty for windows instead
what did you put for ip address?
on windows go to Start->Run, then type:   cmd /k ipconfig  - what address shows up as your ip?
check to see if your software firewall is not enabled, then try pinging your windows again from your linux box
what version of windows you using?
your windows xp firewall or if you have another one such as norton or mcafee etc.
what firewalls did you disable?
that's the only firewall you had?
both are disabled now and you still can't ping .100?
then I don't know what else the problem could be
can you access your router web server and is there a ping option in there?
